Good morning Pearsall ISD community,

We hope everyone is doing well and staying safe.

The PISD Board of Trustees approved two updates in regards to the 2020-2021 school year at a Special Meeting held on 06/24/2020.

The first update is in regards to the School Uniform Policy. Due to uncertainties with the 2020-2021 school year stemming from the COVID-19 pandemic, the PISD Board of Trustees has waived the School Uniform Policy for the 2020-2021 school year. Students will still be expected to follow supplemental dress code expectations which will be outlined in the Student Handbook.

The second update is in regards to the 2020-2021 School Calendar. The PISD Board of Trustees approved an updated calendar to include 180 days of instruction. By including 180 instructional days, TEA will provide more financial support to districts to better support all students. The updated calendar can be viewed at https://drive.google.com/file/d/1iD6Vtw6-M1T_Xi1WeGsOM-cThhsGdiXC/view?usp=sharing.

Thank you for your continuous support!

If you or someone you know entered high school before 2011-2012 and did not graduate with a diploma due to not passing an exit-level State assessment (i.e. TAKS or TAAS), you may now be eligible to graduate.

State law from Senate Bill 463 which was created by the Texas 85th Legislative Session and a resolution that was adopted by the Pearsall ISD Board of Trustees makes this possible.

Senate Bill 463 is set to expire September 1, 2019.

If you know of someone in this situation, please have them contact Mrs. Janet Elizondo, PHS AP/Counselor Secretary at (830) 334-8011.

They will need to schedule an appointment with the Individual Graduation Committee.
